private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E
I see the full public configuration of the pegs
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal primitive moves for the cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan that achieves the goal configuration.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J
I see the full public configuration of the pegs
agent_2.goal: Contribute legal primitive moves for the cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan that achieves the goal configuration.

private_information: I coordinate agents and integrate their proposals
I must produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent proposals into a single valid plan and produce a final PDDL domain and problem that encodes the instance and achieves the specified goal.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency of the proposed plan and PDDL
I remove or flag bookkeeping shortcuts, quota tokens, or post-hoc penalties and ensure only valid primitive moves appear
auditor.goal: Verify that the move sequence and PDDL are consistent with Tower of Hanoi rules, agent move restrictions, and the specified initial and goal states.

public_information: This is a cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks labelled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Agents are restricted: agent_1 may move only disks A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
Legal move: move exactly one disk at a time; only the top disk of a peg may be moved; a disk may be placed only on an empty peg or on a strictly larger disk; pegs are named left, middle, right.
Initial configuration: left peg has top→bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top→bottom B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg has top→bottom A.
Given the goal only relocates the smallest disk A to the right peg while keeping all others in place, the minimal legal plan contains a single move by agent_1.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right

plan_moves.system_prompt: You propose only legal Tower of Hanoi primitive moves you personally can execute (disks A–E) with full respect for the rules; do not emit PDDL; be concise and precise.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1; environment facts: {environment->public_information}; your capability: A–E only; propose the minimal primitive moves you can perform to achieve the goal, formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You propose only legal Tower of Hanoi primitive moves you personally can execute (disks F–J) with full respect for the rules; do not emit PDDL; be concise and precise.
plan_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2; environment facts: {environment->public_information}; your capability: F–J only; propose the minimal primitive moves you can perform to achieve the goal, formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If no move is needed from you, explicitly state none.

synthesize_plan_and_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planner; integrate the agents' proposals into a single legal plan; then produce a PDDL domain and problem for the Tower of Hanoi instance targeting the FastDownward solver; include both within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags; keep agents' actions conceptually distinct in commentary but produce a standard single-agent PDDL that captures disk and peg dynamics.
synthesize_plan_and_pddl.prompt: Integrate the proposed primitive moves from agent_1 and agent_2: {plan_agent_1} and {plan_agent_2}. Confirm legality against {environment->public_information}. Output the final move sequence first as a numbered list using the exact primitive move format, then output a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. The domain should use types disk and peg; predicates: on(?d - disk ?x - either disk peg), clear(?x - either disk peg), smaller(?d1 - disk ?d2 - disk), and auxiliary predicates as needed; provide one action move with preconditions ensuring the Tower of Hanoi legality; the problem should declare disks A–J and pegs left, middle, right; include all smaller relations and initial on/clear facts for the initial configuration and a goal matching the specified goal configuration.

audit_and_sanitize.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the plan and PDDL; reject or flag any shortcutting, quota tokens, or post-hoc penalties; verify every move is legal, respects agent disk permissions, and that the PDDL correctly encodes the instance and achieves the target goal under Tower of Hanoi rules.
audit_and_sanitize.prompt: Audit the orchestrator output {pddl_orchestrator} for legality and consistency against {environment->public_information}. Confirm that each primitive move is legal and that the PDDL domain/problem is correct for FastDownward. Provide a concise pass/fail verdict with specific justifications, and propose corrections if needed.
